actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with unmatched military strength, largest economy by GDP, dominant cultural influence, technological leadership, and control of global financial systems through the USD as reserve currency

sub_actors.name: Executive Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Core executive branch leadership headed by the President, wielding extensive power over federal policy, national security, foreign relations, and military command. Controls federal agencies, issues executive orders, and shapes national agenda.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central banking system that controls US monetary policy, regulates financial institutions, manages currency stability, and influences global markets through interest rates and dollar policy. Critical to economic and financial sovereignty.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: World's largest population, second-largest economy, rising military power, dominant manufacturing base, massive technological advancement, and growing global influence through Belt and Road Initiative

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: The ruling and sole governing party of China, exercising comprehensive control over state apparatus, military, economy, and society. Led by the Politburo Standing Committee and Central Committee, the CCP determines national policy, ideology, and strategic direction through its vast organizational network.

sub_actors.name: Central Military Commission (CMC)
sub_actors.description: Supreme military command organization that controls and directs the People's Liberation Army (PLA). Oversees national defense policy, military strategy, and modernization efforts. Holds significant influence in national security decisions and foreign policy relating to territorial interests.

actors.name: Big Tech Giants (FAANG + Microsoft)
actors.description: Collective technology companies controlling global digital infrastructure, social media, cloud computing, AI development, and having unprecedented influence over information flow and digital economy

sub_actors.name: Board of Directors & Executive Leadership
sub_actors.description: Collective leadership teams across major tech companies that set strategic direction, make key investment decisions, control vast financial resources, and shape corporate policies affecting billions of users globally. They exercise direct control over digital infrastructure development and technological innovation.

sub_actors.name: Corporate Policy & Government Relations Divisions
sub_actors.description: Specialized departments within tech giants that manage regulatory compliance, lobby governments, shape digital policy frameworks, and negotiate with national authorities worldwide. They effectively influence legislation and regulatory frameworks affecting digital markets and technology governance.

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Powerful economic bloc, largest single market, influential regulatory power, major diplomatic force, and standard-setter for global policies on climate, tech, and trade

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch of the EU that proposes legislation, implements decisions, upholds treaties, and manages day-to-day business. Led by the Commission President, it acts as the EU's primary administrative and regulatory authority, representing the interests of the Union as a whole.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Central bank for the Eurozone, controls monetary policy, manages the euro, and supervises banking systems. Has significant influence over economic policy, financial stability, and monetary decisions affecting the entire EU economy.
